physical_appearance: The image shows a paperback. It has a grey background. The title and publisher are printed in black, in the Dutch language. There is a rectangular line in orange that serves to form a margin, between the words and the sides of the page. The font size of the titles vary as well, with some words being bigger than others.
sgcool_label_text:
Written in Dutch, ‘How to make a Good Photo: a book for the amateur photographer’ was published by the Eastman Kodak Company in Batavia. 

The Eastman Kodak Company was established in 1892, and succeeded the company George Eastman first founded when he started producing dry plates for sale in Rochester, New York in 1880. The introduction of the Kodak camera in 1888 marked a milestone in the history of photography for it made photography accessible and affordable to millions of amateurs who were not professionally trained.
title_text: How to make a Good Photo: a book for the amateur photographer
subject_terms_2: Paperbacks Photography Instructional and educational works
